title: Google\Cloud\Compute\V1\MachineImage
name: MachineImage
description:
Represents a machine image resource. A machine image is a Compute Engine resource that stores all the configuration, metadata, permissions, and data from one or more disks required to create a Virtual machine (VM) instance. For more information, see Machine images.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.compute.v1.MachineImage

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.creation_timestamp
params.description: [Output Only] The creation timestamp for this machine image in RFC3339 text format.

params.name: data.description
params.description: An optional description of this resource. Provide this property when you create the resource.

params.name: data.guest_flush
params.description: [Input Only] Whether to attempt an application consistent machine image by informing the OS to prepare for the snapshot process.

params.name: data.id
params.description: [Output Only] A unique identifier for this machine image. The server defines this identifier.

params.name: data.instance_properties
params.description: [Output Only] Properties of source instance

params.name: data.kind
params.description: [Output Only] The resource type, which is always compute#machineImage for machine image.

params.name: data.machine_image_encryption_key
params.description: Encrypts the machine image using a customer-supplied encryption key. After you encrypt a machine image using a customer-supplied key, you must provide the same key if you use the machine image later. For example, you must provide the encryption key when you create an instance from the encrypted machine image in a future request. Customer-supplied encryption keys do not protect access to metadata of the machine image. If you do not provide an encryption key when creating the machine image, then the machine image will be encrypted using an automatically generated key and you do not need to provide a key to use the machine image later.

params.name: data.name
params.description: Name of the resource; provided by the client when the resource is created. The name must be 1-63 characters long, and comply with RFC1035. Specifically, the name must be 1-63 characters long and match the regular expression [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])? which means the first character must be a lowercase letter, and all following characters must be a dash, lowercase letter, or digit, except the last character, which cannot be a dash.

params.name: data.satisfies_pzs
params.description: [Output Only] Reserved for future use.

params.name: data.saved_disks
params.description: An array of Machine Image specific properties for disks attached to the source instance

params.name: data.self_link
params.description: [Output Only] The URL for this machine image. The server defines this URL.

params.name: data.source_disk_encryption_keys
params.description: [Input Only] The customer-supplied encryption key of the disks attached to the source instance. Required if the source disk is protected by a customer-supplied encryption key.

params.name: data.source_instance
params.description: The source instance used to create the machine image. You can provide this as a partial or full URL to the resource. For example, the following are valid values: - https://www.googleapis.com/compute/v1/projects/project/zones/zone /instances/instance - projects/project/zones/zone/instances/instance

params.name: data.source_instance_properties
params.description: [Output Only] DEPRECATED: Please use instance_properties instead for source instance related properties. New properties will not be added to this field.

params.name: data.status
params.description: [Output Only] The status of the machine image. One of the following values: INVALID, CREATING, READY, DELETING, and UPLOADING. Check the Status enum for the list of possible values.

params.name: data.storage_locations
params.description: The regional or multi-regional Cloud Storage bucket location where the machine image is stored.

params.name: data.total_storage_bytes
params.description: [Output Only] Total size of the storage used by the machine image.

methods.name: getMachineImageEncryptionKey
methods.description:
Encrypts the machine image using a customer-supplied encryption key. After you encrypt a machine image using a customer-supplied key, you must provide the same key if you use the machine image later. For example, you must provide the encryption key when you create an instance from the encrypted machine image in a future request. Customer-supplied encryption keys do not protect access to metadata of the machine image. If you do not provide an encryption key when creating the machine image, then the machine image will be encrypted using an automatically generated key and you do not need to provide a key to use the machine image later.

Generated from protobuf field optional .google.cloud.compute.v1.CustomerEncryptionKey machine_image_encryption_key = 528089087;
